results.title: Light waves and their uses
results.brief_description: This elementary explanation of light deals with the following points: the principles of reflection with plane, concave, and convex mirrors; refraction in connection with lenses, with particular reference to the human eye; the principles and applications of interference; polar screens; the electro-magnetic spectrum; the quantum theory.

results.title: Light the empty places
results.creator_credit: Crawford-Senior Film Productions and Andrew Swanson
results.brief_description: A retired school teacher recounts his schooling, teacher training and teaching experiences in various schools with re-enacted sequences. This is followed by a survey of contemporary school facilities and specialised education services in Victoria. Features the Horsham High School Choir. Celebrates a centenary of State education in Victoria 1873-1973.

results.title: Light the deep
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
Defence scientists, using special laser technology, have developed a sophisticated device which will benefit the hydrographers of the world. It is used by the Royal Australian Navy, responsible for the production of all Australian navigational charts.

results.title: Light play: black-white-gray = Ein lightspiel: scwarz-weiss-grau
results.brief_description: Moholy-Nagy, an exponent of modern design in architecture, painting, theatre and typography, illustrates the forms and relationships of his constructivist art. Constructions of steel, glass and wire, including the artist’s light-space modulator, move, merge and dissolve to produce a world of interrelated shapes and patterns. Surface textures, spatial tensions and shadows are combined with the resources of the film cameras - super- impositions, positive-negative contrasts and trick effects to produce rhythms in light, shade, space and movement.

results.title: Light on East Anglia
results.creator_credit: British Travel Association and Associated British-Pathe
results.brief_description: Shows the changing aspects of life in East Anglia from the tranquil dawn until the fading light of evening. Scenes include the rural charm of Suffolk with sleepy one street hamlets; the Norfolk Broads with stately riverside homes; student life at Cambridge; crumbling relics of monastic life in Norfolk; and fishing trawlers from the North Sea. Narrated by William Dexter.

results.title: Light in the jungle
results.creator_credit: Seventh Day Adventist Public Relations Dept
results.brief_description: The challenge of the South Pacific. Fiji has a coconut based economy which has produced new wealth and new problems for the people; learning the value of labour and the use of money. Tells of the combined efforts of government officials and missionaries to solve these problems. Graduates of the Seventh Day Adventist Medical Training College in Lae, New Guinea, help village people learn personal hygiene, and sanitation as well as how to overcome fears and superstitions.

results.title: Light in the darkness
results.creator_credit: M. Bhavnani, Documentary Films of India and K Khandpur
results.brief_description: Today there are more than 50 schools for the blind in India where children as well as adults receive education and training. The Central Braille Printing Press at Dehra Dun is dedicated to serving the sightless. The training centre for the adult blind, also located at Dehra Dun, is one of the most important centres of its kind in the country. Weaving is among the principal technical trades taught.

results.title: Light illumination and its measurement
results.brief_description: Illustrates the common sources of artificial light and explains their operation. Describes in detail the measurement of light, indicating luminous intensity, luminous flux and illumination. Explains and demonstrates such basic terms as candle power, lumen and foot-candle.

results.title: Light from within
results.creator_credit: David Hopwood and Northern Virginia Community College. Extended Learning Institute
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Developing image”.
Examines the artistic aspects of photography, comparing it with trends in modern art, and deals with early and contemporary creative photography. The trend towards graphic experimentation is examined through a discussion with contemporary photographers who are leading practitioners in their fields.
